meeting_annotations.speaker: Erika Matunis
meeting_annotations.transcript: I mean I know our institution just mandated mentor training you know which I'd have always been keen on it anyway but now all the faculty have had quite a bit of it and so we're all really aware that you know mentors have different roles and that you should have multiple mentors and it should be something you it's a lifelong goal to improve at you know. So I feel like awareness is better but it is a really urgent need you know because a student in distress can be gone in a matter of months not you know so it's it's a pretty serious issue. But I do think institutions do have a role by insisting and I think the NIH has a role by acknowledging because right now when you send in your bio sketch I usually do mention mentoring in there but it's not part of the typical form right and I you know thankfully I work at a school that does account for mentoring at promotion if someone has any hint of an issue with mentoring in all of those letters that come in from around the world there will be a discussion you know because we take it very seriously but that could be a value for every school.
